humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there are metastases in 3 out of the 4 sentinel lymph nodes (SLN #1, SLN #2, and SLN #4) with the largest tumor metastasis measuring 2 mm. Therefore, based on the AJCC staging system and the new rules provided, the pathologic N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer involvement in the lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has cancer in 3 out of the 4 sentinel lymph nodes (SLN #1, SLN #2, and SLN #4) with the largest tumor metastasis measuring 2 mm. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1, which indicates cancer has spread to 1-3 axillary lymph nodes.
